It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in dense forest undergrowth where it can receive indirect sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Werneria sotarensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
